channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Got a Residential Meal Plan? You’ve Got Guest Swipes!
item.description: Good news students! If you have a residential meal plan you now have 4 Guest Swipes to use.
item.author: Students

item.title: Mandatory TA Training | Aug. 27
item.description: Date: Wednesday, August 27, 2025 9:00 AM - 7:00 PM - There will be two sessions: morning (9am-2pm) and afternoon (1pm-6pm). All incoming TAs are required to register for one of the sessions. Each session will feature short talks from current TAs and faculty covering topics such as TA best practices, dealing with problems in the classroom, and maintaining work-life balance. Light snacks and lunch will be provided.
item.author: Students

item.title: PhD Students’ Orientation | Aug. 26
item.description: Date: Tuesday, August 26, 2025 12:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Lunch will begin at 12pm at Heffner Alumni house. We will then take a quick campus tour ending in DCC308 for welcome notes and a panel discussion with faculty advisors (1:30-3pm). The campus resource fair will begin at 3:30pm, and while you wait you can get to know your peers better over coffee and cookies. Orientation will end at 5pm.
item.author: Students

item.title: Masters Students’ Orientation | Aug. 26
item.description: Date: Tuesday, August 26, 2025 1:30 PM - 5:30 PM - Lunch will begin at 1:30pm at Heffner Alumni house. During lunch, you will have a chance to ask questions and learn about your expected journey at RPI. We will walk together to the campus resource fair, which will begin at 3:30pm in DCC. Orientation will end at 5pm.
item.author: Students

item.title: Fall 2025 Shuttle Service
item.description: The Parking and Transportation Department would like to inform the RPI community that shuttle service for the fall semester will begin on August 25th.
item.author: Community

item.title: CMDIS Facilities Open House | Sept. 3 Sign up by Aug. 29
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM - Center for Materials, Devices and Integrated Systems (CMDIS) invites you to the Facilities Open House. Sign-up for facility tours to learn about new acquisitions, tools, instrumentation capabilities, fabrication and characterization techniques. Get information about educational programs and short courses. Meet with our technical team and discuss how we can help your research. The event will be followed by BBQ. Sign-up to tours by 08/29.
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Mercer Lecture: “Implantable Biofuel Cells” | Sept. 10
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 10, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join us for an ECSE Distinguished Mercer Lecture: “Implantable Biofuel Cells” with Prof. Evgeny Katz of Clarkson University. Abstract and speaker bio can be found at the event URL.
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO announces upcoming upgrade to SIS
item.description: Members of DotCIO’s Enterprise Information Services team are pleased to announce upcoming changes to SIS (Student Information System) on Wednesday September 17. This upgrade brings a fresh look, improved navigation, and a more user-friendly experience. Please click in for a link to a short video providing a tour of the new landing page and where to find the tools you use most.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty and Staff In-Person Workshop: Tips for Incorporating Digital Story Telling as Assignments | Sept. 8
item.description: Date: Monday, September 8, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - In this workshop we will discuss a high overview of the meaning of digital story telling, advantages, story telling assignment practices, and review the Six-Word Story, Six Unique Shots assignment concept. Maureen Fodera (Office of Undergraduate Education) will be presenting this workshop. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: “4 Steps to Effective Communication: Extended DISC” | Sept. 10
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, September 10, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Our success, both personally and professionally, is largely determined by our ability to communicate effectively with a variety of people. In this workshop, participants will receive individualized Extended DISC reports (based on the completion of the Extended DISC questionnaire) that reflect both their “natural” and “adjusted” behavioral styles and learn strategies which promote successful interactions with others.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
